column5: ALgonquin ice is all broken up but still not passable..... looks like its going to be a matter of days.

Yes... that's Temagami Marine's boat launch in Inlet Bay.. Generally the first area for the ice to let go with Lowell Lake pouring into it and were Darren from Lakeland Airways first stages his Beaver at his Mother's dock waiting for Portage Bay to open up. And speaking of the Portage Bay.. which is just North of Inlet Bay with the PPark separating them. My neighbour rode his sled over and checked how my docks survived the winter yesterday!

Yes... that's Temagami Marine's boat launch in Inlet Bay.. Generally the first area for the ice to let go with Lowell Lake pouring into it and were Darren from Lakeland Airways first stages his Beaver at his Mother's dock waiting for Portage Bay to open up. And speaking of the Portage Bay.. which is just North of Inlet Bay with the PPark separating them. My neighbour rode his sled over and checked how my docks survived the winter yesterday!     Hey thanks for the updates. Still got my fingers crossed it will be out by the long weekend.
Crappy weather tomorrow. Anyone going to be out on gbay?
I was hoping to get out today but with NW winds of 35k gusting to 54 for the Lindsay area I might just delay my first trip out this year until Monday.
Inlet Bay today on Lake Temagami.. again, one of the first places to let go on the lake. This looks like about 3 days to go.. .the rest of the lake will be a week plus behind that I suspect.
Man its gonna be a close one this year. Hope the weather this week and next can take care of that ice.
-C temps at night aren't helping!

-C temps at night aren't helping! Indeed.  From what I have seen documented over at Ottertooth, this year might make the record for the latest ice out since 1986. Of course thats other than the 2 years they dont have documented.
taken from my deck this afternoon. with opener in 11 days, it doesn't look good
waiting for Hartley Bay (Fr. River) to thaw still also. hopefully sometime this week they say.
A slow process when it refreezes every night! They now think the Bay might open by Friday and the rest of the lake generally a week later!
Laker lake opened up around here on Monday/Tuesday...spent yesterday trolling the ice line with no luck...good to finally be back on the softwater though!
Inlet Bay is now open... gas dock is in. The rest of the lake, still using the air boats and walking beside canoes to get to their islands on Lake Temagami.
keep the updates coming Wayne  we will be up there on the 20th , feeling a little better now!
I heard they were breaking ice up there yesterday with boats.  Dont think you'll have much to worry about come the 20th. I'm still hoping the 16th is a go.

As of 3 pm this afternoon,  Portage Bay is almost ice free from Town out to the O'Connor Island flasher. My neighbour checked my docks for damage this afternoon.. this time in a boat. NE Arm is still locked up... but should go in a few days.
I heard a lot of it broke up today. Many from bear Island are putting boats in today as well. Looks like I'll be good to go come friday for the drive down to cross.

Just got a report from the Parry Sound area and the ice is melting fast and with all this rain coming this week expect open water on inland lakes by this weekend !  Sounds looks open.  Time to break out the planner boards and go wash some body baits
Soon Bill , very soon
Foul east wind blowing on Kempenfelt bay today. Big white caps always look strange to me crashing at the tiffin launch.
With the howling wind out there today.. she'll be clear no doubt Bill !
What's the consensus for Lake Nipissing ?     All time record record maybe safe, but what about beating 1996 - 97 ?  http://ufrca.com/index.php?page=ice_out_dates

Bill, what's your best source of satellite images?  You can try this one - https://earthdata.nasa.gov/labs/worldview/?switch=geographic&products=baselayers,!MODIS_Aqua_CorrectedReflectance_TrueColor,MODIS_Terra_CorrectedReflectance_TrueColor~overlays,sedac_bound&time=2014-04-19&map=-82.889404,44.088867,-78.670654,46.116943   It's a little more user friendly and loads alot faster.

Apparently the elders on Bear Island, Lake Temagami, are getting worried it will be at least the 18th of May before they can boat to the landing... and the last week of May before the lake is ice free. Average of 20" of ice still on the lake, with areas as thick as 40.

Apparently the elders on Bear Island, Lake Temagami, are getting worried it will be at least the 18th of May before they can boat to the landing... and the last week of May before the lake is ice free. Average of 20" of ice still on the lake, with areas as thick as 40.    I hope not, that would put the kaibosh on the long weekend. That still seems like a lot of ice though. Gonna be touch and go from here on out I guess. Hopefully the rain this week will speed things up a bit.

You can try this one - https://earthdata.nasa.gov/labs/worldview/?switch=geographic&products=baselayers,!MODIS_Aqua_CorrectedReflectance_TrueColor,MODIS_Terra_CorrectedReflectance_TrueColor~overlays,sedac_bound&time=2014-04-19&map=-82.889404,44.088867,-78.670654,46.116943   It's a little more user friendly and loads alot faster.  Seems about 10 days behind unfortunately.
Northeast Georgian Bay still has ice as far as I can see all the back bays and coves are still solid as well..was out in the boat Sat ..hopefully this high wind and heavy rain stirs the pot
Had a guy out here watersking last Sunday (either that or they were using the biggest muskie bait I have ever seen and going way too fast).  Water is still really cold but no ice in sight.
Seems about 10 days behind unfortunately.  Just select the day you want to see.  Its about 1 day behind.
Just select the day you want to see.  Its about 1 day behind.  Seems to work fine for me and I like the zoom feature.
This is what Nipissing looks like a few minutes ago, the west side of it. Tons of melting happening.
Algonquin Park waters melting fast http://www.algonquinpark.on.ca/news/ice-out.php  Got an email that Benoir Lake, Elephant Lake area lakes have melted

Had a guy out here watersking last Sunday (either that or they were using the biggest muskie bait I have ever seen and going way too fast).  Water is still really cold but no ice in sight.  It's one thing to hit a  half sunken hut, or deadhead, in a boat. It is something all together different to hit them on skis.

Midland Harbour and the immediate Sound appear open... but the launch ramp and Pete Peterson park shore is loaded with ice out past the entrance to to Bay Port where they have started putting in boats finally. About 2 weeks behind schedule.
Home lake in Seguin is still 70% ice covered as of Sunday past. Planned to launch the boat this weekend delayed but shod be good to go for pike/walleye opener.
Hunters Bay on Nipissing opened up today.The main lake looks like it will take at least another week.

Things really opened up this week with all the wind and rain.  I went for a scoot down some logging roads behind my place and the snow is about 80% gone and the pot lakes are wide open.  This trail would have had 2 feet snow not long ago...ice out trout happening this weekend!
To those launching into Gbay, how are the launches? I normally only go out of honey harbour which have great launches but may venture elsewhere.
pier 69 is in good shape  20 bucks
No launching for me just yet...
pier 69 is in good shape  20 bucks  Thanks. Have to decide between the two. Always do well in HH, but more numbers over size.
No launching for me just yet...  Is that Temagami? Looks like it wont be too long now judging from your pic.
Saw open water on Fork lake on the AP webcam
Ice breaker finally made it to Midland Harbour... only took them 2 weeks !! lol

Here is the front yard, Lake Nipissing by the mouth of the Sturgeon River. Starting to break up. The mouth of the river is open and you can hear the ice moving. Had some good wind today and rain in the forecast for the next two days.

Was up in Minden yesterday Head lake had lots of open water but still some ice. There is still some snow in the bush but most of that is gone now. Miners Bay still had a fair bit of ice but I think that was mostly from the wind.

Here's the only "open water" in front of my dock, as of yesterday! What was our ice road is now a long swimming pool.. allowing folks to see how their sleds run on open water, just so they know if they ever get into trouble. Great opportunity ...with a built in 25" ice security blanket underneath!!
Thats a lot of fun Wayne. Did that a couple weekends ago.  Was out on Nipissing this morning for a ride. Fish Bay is clear and Hunters Bay will open up in a day or two.
Beauty day up here today. Lots of blue out there now. Still lots of ice but there's hope.
Took a quick scoot over to the Kipawa launch to see how the lakes looking...
Lookin' good Joey. That must be a beauty ramp to watch during "rush hour".
Kempenfelt bay was completely ice free as far as I could see this am.
Looks like I actually might make the pike opener on Gbay after all!
Midland Harbour was still full of ice yesterday.. even after the icebreaker left.
Midland Harbour was still full of ice yesterday.. even after the icebreaker left.  Satellite photos show lots of open water around Honey Harbour.  Unless that's all crappy ice.
The channel at the Delawana was opening way back the last time I went flying.. so yah it could very well be open all through there in the current from the Squash..

The channel at the Delawana was opening way back the last time I went flying.. so yah it could very well be open all through there in the current from the Squash..  That's the general direction I was planing on heading for opener.
Satellite photos show lots of open water around Honey Harbour.  Unless that's all crappy ice.  Bill, what's your best source of satellite images?
Bill, what's your best source of satellite images?  I think most are using this.   http://coastwatch.glerl.noaa.gov/modis/region_map.html
Maybe the boat gets wet this Friday.
Hopefully it clears, want to head to gbay
Wish I had one of those ice breakers... Looks like we might need it for Temagami May long weekend.

Ice hasn't even pulled away from shore or the boat ramp at Temagami Marine as of today. My neighbour was sledding down the lake as of last night..... that said, it will be gone by the 17th. Probably a few bergs floating around.. but it will be gone.

Ice hasn't even pulled away from shore or the boat ramp at Temagami Marine as of today. My neighbour was sledding down the lake as of last night..... that said, it will be gone by the 17th. Probably a few bergs floating around.. but it will be gone.  My aunt lives on Bear Island, we spoke with her today, she said much of the same, still lots of ice but will be gone by the long weekend. My fingers are crossed to say the least.
May long will be prime time laker time
For sure Joey... they'll be cruising the top 10 feet !  Here's a shot from Temagami Marines "boat launch" this afternoon...
Just got a report from the Parry Sound area and the ice is melting fast and with all this rain coming this week expect open water on inland lakes by this weekend !
Maybe a good time to start a thread... if you have open water post it here... I heard Bay of Quinte is open West of Bellville.
http://coastwatch.glerl.noaa.gov/webdata/cwops/html/modis/modis.php?region=g&page=1&template=sub&image=t1.14106.1558.CIS_Great_Lakes.143.250m.jpg
A watched pot never boils, in this case, a watched lake never melts
someone said a watched soft lake never hardens... boy were they wrong...
There was a guy out ice fishing on the bay in Midland today so no open water there lol....  Burt
I will be putting a boat in tomorrow.
on the satellite map, where ever there us current, the ice is gone  either side of Trent Locks, narrows or rivermouths

Got out with the kids this eve in a small tiny.  Looked for some crappie.  We found none, but we all had a good time, just getting out seeing the ducks, and the kids ate some of the ice that is 100 ft off-shore.  Good times.  We might try again tomorrow but with worms this time.  Entropy
Yup I can confirm that, Presqu'ile Bay (Brighton) has open water all the way across the bay
Lakes are still completely ice covered in the Parry Sound area with only the area's of incoming streams open . Actually seen someone ice fishing today on Lake Manitouwabing (20 km NE of Parry Sound)

Pigeon is still mostly ice covered except Nogies Bay is about half open and the creek is flowing a ton...only drove as far as the dump so only saw the north shore...hell, I still got snow in my backyard and along the north side of our house...

Pigeon is still mostly ice covered except Nogies Bay is about half open and the creek is flowing a ton...only drove as far as the dump so only saw the north shore...hell, I still got snow in my backyard and along the north side of our house... Happy to hear it Beansie. That means the crappie should be prime when we come up the first of May

Channel is open in front of our place on Sturgeon Lake but there is still plenty of ice both sides of the channel. I am hoping I might be able to get the boat in next weekend but unless there is a serious melt I still won't be able to go anywhere except up river.
Hamilton Harbour is open, not to stained depending on where you go.

My neighbor down the road  stores his 20' boat in his boat house for the winter but hoists it up on slings to keep it out of the ice. Now the water is rising so high (Clear Lake) that the boat is floating and the water is pushing it closer to the roof of the boat house. Trouble is the ice is only a couple feet outside the boat house and he can't get the boat out.  Gonna be a tense few more days until hopefully the water level drops a bit.
Sturgeon is splitting open down the middle probably moved 1 km today. Be in boat next weekend if not have to make the drive to cooks bay

Drove all over yesterday. The only open launch I found was in rosedale, but balsam wass ice covered. Sturg, pigeon, cameron, simcoe, and most of scugog are all ice covered. East end of the bog is opening up, but main lake has ice still.  Hopefully next weekend.  S.
Got the boat out today for the 3rd time this year, back bays are still ice covered so no crappies for me!
been out five times so far...but all on lake ontario....not much help for "inland lakes".
Kempenfelt bay this afternoon:

Brought my boat home from the cottage in the fall as I wanted to do a ton of spring fishing, now the only thing I get to do is listen to my wife complain that I brought the boat home and never used it
Tiffin Launch today at 1pm
Crazy what some wind does
mapleview    innisfil beach park
Nice pictures guys.Looks like May 10 will be doable.Funny how fast it melts with a few  warm temps and wind.
